definition: A term referring to the outer area or periphery of a city, typically characterized by a mix of residential and industrial zones. It is commonly used to describe the outskirts or suburbs of a city, where urban development transitions into more rural or less densely populated areas.

examples.english: The supermarket is located on the outskirts of town.

examples.german: Wir wohnen am Stadtrand von Berlin.
examples.english: We live on the outskirts of Berlin.

examples.german: Der Stadtrand ist ruhiger als das Stadtzentrum.
examples.english: The outskirts are quieter than the city center.

examples.german: Viele Familien ziehen auf den Stadtrand, um mehr Platz zu haben.
examples.english: Many families move to the outskirts to have more space.

examples.german: Es gibt einen schönen Park am Stadtrand.
examples.english: There is a beautiful park on the outskirts.
